title: For the Fourth Time, Citibank Hungary's Zero-Fee Bank Account Earns Best Bank Account Award in the MasterCard - Bank of the Year Competition
summary: Budapest - For the fourth consecutive year, Citibank Hungary's Zero-Fee Bank Account was voted #1 in the 2011 MasterCard - Bank of the Year competition. No other financial institution has achieved four awards for a single product over the six-year history of MasterCard's industry competition in Hungary.
tag-1: For the Fourth Time, Citibank Hungary's Zero-Fee Bank Account Earns Best Bank Account Award in the MasterCard - Bank of the Year Competition
tag-2: Budapest – For the fourth consecutive year, Citibank Hungary's Zero-Fee Bank Account was voted #1 in the 2011 MasterCard – Bank of the Year competition. No other financial institution has achieved four awards for a single product over the six-year history of MasterCard's industry competition in Hungary.
tag-3: In addition to capturing the top spot in the Best Bank Account Award Category, Citibank was voted among the top three Best Banks in Hungary. For its programs focusing on financial education, building social enterprises and driving environmental awareness with customers, Citibank was also honored for the fourth time in the Best Bank for Corporate Social Responsibility category.
tag-4: Batara Sianturi, Citi Country Officer for Hungary, said, "We are proud to have won – for the fourth year in a row – the Best Bank Account Award in MasterCard's Award Competition – a major benchmark of excellence in Hungary's banking industry. In addition, it is a historic achievement for Citibank Hungary to be inducted to the top-three banks in the country, which is a reinforcement of our commitment to customers, innovation and client excellence."
tag-5: Jon Wiggins, Consumer Business Manager for Hungary, remarked, "Winning this outstanding accolade for the fourth time in a row is a professional recognition of the value we create for our customers, proving that Citibank is a credible and trustworthy institution. I would like to thank our teams for the passion they provide in serving our customers and for demonstrating the spirit required to win in a challenging macroeconomic environment."
tag-6: Citibank's Zero-Fee Bank Account, launched in March 2008, was Hungary's first free bank account package that provides customers with unprecedented comfort and freedom in managing their finances. Customers selecting the Zero-Fee Bank Account are offered unlimited domestic currency cash, online and phone service transactions and a free chip debit card with three complimentary supplementary cards.
tag-7: About the MasterCard – Bank of the Year Competition The MasterCard – Bank of the Year Competition has been running in Hungary since 2006; MasterCard Worldwide has been the main sponsor of the competition. The awards of the professional categories are determined through anonymous voting by an independent 100-member professional jury made up of business leaders, economic journalists and university teachers. The Banker of the Year Award is decided through a vote of invited bank CEOs. The Best Bank for Corporate Social Responsibility category was launched in 2008 and submissions are evaluated by a separate jury consisting of representatives of major non-profit organizations in Hungary.
tag-8: More information about Citibank's Zero-Fee Bank Account and other Citibank products and services as well as Citibank's corporate social responsibility programs are available at Citibank's website at www.citibank.hu.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
